info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 25 at 1:59PM MDT until June 26 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
Deep monsoonal moisture remains in place for today into this evening, with any thunderstorm capable of producing rainfall rates of 2 inches per hour. Although moisture becomes more diffuse on Thursday, numerous slow-moving showers and thunderstorms are forecast to develop over the Sacramento Mountains on Thursday afternoon. This will lead to renewed flash flooding concerns on the Ruidoso area and Seven Springs burn scars.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible.
* WHERE...A portion of south central New Mexico, including the following areas, East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet, Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet and West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet.
* WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Thursday evening.
* IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Another round of thunderstorms, this time slow-moving, is forecast for Thursday. This will lead to renewed concerns for flooding, especially on burn scar areas. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING

area.areaDesc: West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
